intro: Kennedia exaltata, commonly known as the scarlet pagoda, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces striking red or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in coastal and sandy habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping.
